questions.question_text:
You have devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune as shown in the following table.
//IMG//

You create an app protection policy named Policy1 that has the following settings:
✑ Platform: Windows 10
✑ Protected apps: App1
✑ Exempt apps: App2
✑ Network boundary: Cloud resources, IPv4 ranges
You assign Policy1 to Group1 and Group2. You exclude Group3 from Policy1.
Which devices will apply Policy1?

discussion.content: Only applies to 4 and 5. 'Exclude' overrides 'Apply'. 1, 2 and 3 are excluded by membership. 4 and 5 are the only ones that get it applied.

Answer is C - 

Exclusion takes precedence over inclusion in the following same group type scenarios:
• Including user groups and excluding user groups when assigning apps
• Including device groups and excluding device group when assigning apps
For example, if you assign a device group to the All corporate users user group, but exclude members in the Senior Management Staff user group, All corporate users except the Senior Management staff get the assignment, because both groups are user groups.
So many comments for an easy question. Answer is C.

Selected Answer: C

questions.answer_description:
Intune device configuration profiles let you include and exclude groups from profile assignment. Exclusion takes precedence over inclusion in same group types.
Policy1 excludes Group3 and Group3 includes Device1, Device2, and Device3.
Incorrect Answers:
A, B, D: Device1, Device2, and Device3 are members of Group3. Policy1 excludes Group3. Exclusion takes precedence over inclusion.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/configuration/device-profile-assign#exclude-groups-from-a-profile-assignment https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/app-protection-policies

Your network contains an Active Directory domain that is synced to Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription. All computers are joined to the domain and have the latest Microsoft OneDrive sync client (OneDrive.exe) installed.
On all the computers, you configure the OneDrive settings as shown in the following exhibit.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: This one was easy. Tip: always read what they are asking first. Then go back to the information.
Question was so easy it felt like a trick

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: The Documents folder -
Silently move known folders to OneDrive is enabled. Known folder include:
Desktop, Documents, Pictures, Screenshots, and Camera Roll
Box 2: enable OneDrive files On-Demand
OneDrive Files On-Demand enables users to view, search for, and interact with files stored in OneDrive from within File Explorer without downloading them and taking up space on the local hard drive.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/redirect-known-folders https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/plan-onedrive-enterprise

discussion.content:
From the provided link:
Conditional launch
As apps often have distinct versioning schemes between them, create a policy with one minimum app version targeting one app (for example, Outlook version policy).
Access requirements
Set a requirement for either numeric or passcode type PINs before accessing an app that has app protection policies applied. Numeric requirements involve only numbers, while a passcode can be defined with at least 1 alphabetical letter or at least 1 special character.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/app-protection-policy-settings-ios

comments.content: Pretty accurate except the reason it is Conditional Launch is because you can set 'device conditions' which allow you to block/allow OS versions; which is what the question asks.

discussion.content: The Intune layout for creating these policies look different nowadays. Answer given still correct.
Good answer!
correct

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Conditional launch -
Configure conditional launch settings to set sign-in security requirements for your access protection policy.
By default, several settings are provided with pre-configured values and actions. You can delete some of these, like the Min OS version. You can also select additional settings from the Select one dropdown.
Note: There are three categories of policy settings: Data relocation, Access requirements, and Conditional launch.

Box 2. Access requirements -
Access requirements include:
PIN for access: Select Require to require a PIN to use this app. The user is prompted to set up this PIN the first time they run the app in a work or school context.
The PIN is applied when working either online or offline.
You can configure the PIN strength using the settings available under the PIN for access section.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/app-protection-policy-settings-ios

Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: Apps, and then App protection policies

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
You need to download a report that lists all the devices that are NOT enrolled in Microsoft Intune and are assigned an app protection policy.
What should you select in the Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It's simply impossible to be A. Their own link provided says "app-protection-policies-monitor" monitor, people! And App report is under Monitor | App protection status > Reports | App report
C'mon!

comments.content: There is absolutely no report on Apps | App protection policies. Only policies!

discussion.content: Correct

Selected Answer: C
The options **A. Apps, and then App protection policies** and **B. Apps, and then Monitor** in the Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center are not the correct choices for the following reasons:

- **A. Apps, and then App protection policies**: This section is used to create, configure, and assign app protection policies. It does not provide a report of devices that are not enrolled in Intune.

- **B. Apps, and then Monitor**: This section provides monitoring and analytics for your apps. It does not provide a report of devices that are not enrolled in Intune.

The **Devices > Monitor** section provides various reports related to device enrollment. Therefore, it is the correct choice for downloading a report that lists all the devices that are NOT enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

Selected Answer: B
It should be B
Answer should be B. Apps, and then Monitor
